hypothesis_content.title: Stablecoin Supply Growth as BTC Leading Indicator
hypothesis_content.statement: When the aggregate stablecoin market cap (USDT, USDC, DAI) grows by >2% over a 7-day period during a NEUTRAL or BEAR regime, entering a long BTC position will yield positive alpha over the following 10 trading days, as new liquidity precedes price appreciation.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Stablecoin supply growth represents new on-chain dry powder. In neutral/bear regimes, this accumulation often precedes bullish moves as liquidity seeks deployment. Recent news highlights 'liquidity rises' as a key December hope, making this timing signal relevant.
entry_conditions: 7d % change in aggregate stablecoin market cap > 2%
BTC price is below its 50-day moving average (oversold/neutral condition)

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC price crosses above its 50-day MA and gains 8% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If stablecoin growth consistently fails to translate to BTC upside within 10 days (success rate < 40%), the hypothesis is falsified (suggests liquidity is being used for other purposes or is ineffective).
